what: Finding indices for Dates Relevant to the MSD Calculations — msdDates
title: Finding indices for Dates Relevant to the MSD Calculations — msdDates
text: function pulls indices associated dates correspond Mid Summer Drought, well indices indicate first last day year. function used conjunction MSD function.

title: Finding indices for Dates Relevant to the MSD Calculations — msdDates
Finding indices for Dates Relevant to the MSD Calculations — msdDates
text: x Date vector peakwindow1 desired date MMDD format begin search early peak minwindow1 desired date MMDD format begin search minimum minwindow2 desired date MMDD format end search minimum peakwindow2 desired date MMDD format end search late peak

title: Finding indices for Dates Relevant to the MSD Calculations — msdDates
text: Vector containing indices corresponding year's beginning date, end date, critical MSD dates

title: Finding indices for Dates Relevant to the MSD Calculations — msdDates
code: x <- seq(from = as.Date("1981-01-01"), to = as.Date("1985-12-31"), by = "day") output <- msdDates(x, peakwindow1 = "05-01", minwindow1 = "06-01",                     minwindow2 = "08-31", peakwindow2 = "10-31")

what: msdFilter -- A triangular Filter for smoothing data — msdFilter
title: msdFilter -- A triangular Filter for smoothing data — msdFilter
text: filter take weighted average specified number points around point interest create smoother time series. example, size filter set 31, filter take 15 points point interest (total 31 points), calculate weighted average based far away points point interest.

title: msdFilter -- A triangular Filter for smoothing data — msdFilter
msdFilter -- A triangular Filter for smoothing data — msdFilter
text: x TimeSeries numeric vector window Size Filter [Default = 31] quantity Number passes apply filter [Default = 2]

title: msdFilter -- A triangular Filter for smoothing data — msdFilter
text: Vector Yearly data

title: msdFilter -- A triangular Filter for smoothing data — msdFilter
code: # using a Time Series # r<-msdFilter(x, window = 31, quantity = 2)

what: Mid Summer Drought Time Series Graphs — msdGraph
title: Mid Summer Drought Time Series Graphs — msdGraph
text: Plots Time Series Mid Summer Drought data. input must form daily data, first data point January 1st respective year.

title: Mid Summer Drought Time Series Graphs — msdGraph
code: msdGraph(x, year, peakwindow1, minwindow1, minwindow2, peakwindow2, quantity, window, timeVector)

title: Mid Summer Drought Time Series Graphs — msdGraph
text: x vector data xts year year interest peakwindow1 desired date MMDD format begin analysis (window 1) minwindow1 desired date MMDD format end analysis (window 1) minwindow2 desired date MMDD format begin analysis (window 2) peakwindow2 desired date MMDD format end analysis (window 2) quantity amount times filter run window size filter timeVector vector dates (needed xts inputs)

title: Mid Summer Drought Time Series Graphs — msdGraph
text: Graph Time Series Data

title: Mid Summer Drought Time Series Graphs — msdGraph
code: # graph = msdGraph(x, year, peakwindow1="05-01", minwindow1="06-01", # minwindow2 ="08-31", peakwindow2="10-31", quantity = 2, window = 31)

title: Mid Summer Drought Function — msdMain
text: Generates relevant statistics Mid Summer Drought running msdStats function every applicable metric. output msdMain dataframe containing every msdStats output available years data.

title: Mid Summer Drought Function — msdMain
code: msdMain(x, peakwindow1, minwindow1, minwindow2, peakwindow2, quantity, window, timeVector)

title: Mid Summer Drought Function — msdMain
text: x xts vector data peakwindow1 desired date MMDD format begin analysis (window 1) minwindow1 desired date MMDD format end analysis (window 1) minwindow2 desired date MMDD format begin analysis (window 2) peakwindow2 desired date MMDD format end analysis (window 2) quantity amount times filter run window size filter timeVector vector dates (needed xts inputs)

title: Mid Summer Drought Function — msdMain
text: Data frame relevant MSD Statistics

title: Mid Summer Drought Function — msdMain
code: # using timeseries (ts) # output = msdMain(ts, peakwindow1="05-01", minwindow1="08-31", # minwindow2 ="06-01", peakwindow2="10-31", quantity = 2, window = 31)

what: Main Mid Summer Drought Calculation Function — msdStats
title: Main Mid Summer Drought Calculation Function — msdStats
text: function calculates different statistics mid summer drought Time Series. input must form daily data, first data point January 1st respective year.

title: Main Mid Summer Drought Calculation Function — msdStats
Main Mid Summer Drought Calculation Function — msdStats
text: x Filtered xts data (msdFilter) dates Vector Dates (msdDates function) fcn Specify values pulled function. Options 'duration', 'intensity', 'firstMaxValue', 'secondMaxValue', 'min', 'mindex'.

title: Main Mid Summer Drought Calculation Function — msdStats
text: SpatRaster TimeSeries Yearly data

title: Main Mid Summer Drought Calculation Function — msdStats
code: # using spatRaster # r <- terra::app(raster, msdStats, dates = d1, fcn="duration")
